column1: 4.2.3.1.1	 Summary of evidence and recommendation for history and physical examination
Measure post-void residual (PVR) volume, particularly when assessing patients with voiding   symptoms or complicated stress urinary incontinence (SUI).
When measuring PVR volume, use ultrasound in preference to catheterisation.
Monitor PVR volume in patients scheduled for treatment that may cause or worsen voiding   dysfunction, including surgery for SUI.
